text: Czesław Kaczmarek (April 16, 1895 – August 26, 1963) was a Polish Roman Catholic bishop of the Diocese of Kielce, known for his firm stance against Communism and his persecution under the Polish People's Republic. As a prominent church leader, he faced significant oppression, including arrest and imprisonment, due to his outspoken opposition to the state's policies regarding religion and human rights. == References == == Other website == * Official Website of the Diocese of Kielce Category:1895 births Category:1963 deaths Category:Polish Roman Catholic bishops
title: Czesław Kaczmarek
